hello,
im also quite new to prism but from what i understand you could create a custom window manager and then create a RegionAdapter/RegionBehavior that places views in new windows when they are added to the reagion.

im currently working on a RegionAdapter for the ribbon control that allows views to just provide one a bunch of ribbon tabs and then have the shell compose the ribbon from that.. the api for regionadapters is pretty cool i gotta say :)

if you mean completly separare region managers in diffrent windows, there appears to be something called region scope that might be worth checking out.. im not sure how it works yet but it seems useful for multi layer composition, like if a view is a in it self a shell that has sub views (please correct me on this if im wrong :) )
you can read about scoped regions here: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd458944.aspx (pretty far down, searching for it is easiest)
